characters: SARAH, THAT WAS NOT A HUMAN FUCKING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the chill calm of the winter countryside, sit the two vehicles. A pool of BLOOD oozes from the car like an oil flowing slowly towards the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH, lying in intensive care, broken and bruised but al wired up to all manner of equipment. A heart monitor blee regularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA. Illuminated by five flickering candles on the bi cake in front of her, she giggles slightly as she turns t at someone behind her...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT ec ECU - SARAH’s eyes open wide. She doesn’t jump. It is as waking from a slumber. She looks around at this strange unfamiliar room, at the tubes and needles in her arms. As she begins to pull them out, the heart monitor flat-li gives off a steady, constant tone. She gets out of bed and we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The entire building is apparently deserted as SARAH emerg her room. She pauses, looking each way, the pure white of fluorescent lights almost glaringly harsh. Suddenly, beyond her, the furthest FLUORESCENT light flic and dies, leaving a gaping black hole at the far end of t corridor. SARAH turns to it, entranced by the shadows. We hear something within the darkness, a scratching sound, t breathing... SARAH backs away.... Another light goes out, the next on extending the darkness toward her, following her as she retreats, walking at first, but when a third light goes o quickens her pace. Again we hear the sounds coming from within the darkness, with her own gasping as she breaks into a run, the light switching off in succession behind her, the darkness purs her along the corridor and catching up. No matter how fas runs, she cannot get away from it, until at last she glan behind her and the light above her goes out! Now she is in the darkness, running after the light. She back. There is a harsh rasping shriek, coming at her from shadows, and she turns back she runs headlong into BETH! SUDDENLY everything returns to normality! They are in a b hospital corridor. All the lights are on. People come and and SARAH is still just outside her hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah? But SARAH is a quivering wreck, unable to fathom reality, clinging to BETH for support. BETH (cont'd) Doctor? DOCTOR?! We look over BETH’s shoulder at SARAH’s eyes, blank, star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYING low across the treetops we follow a CAR, its headl on full beam, winding its way along a deserted road high mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH drives. Next to her SARAH, her hair cut shorter, sta blankly out at the passing road. BETH is fiddling with th from which some swampy, twangy music emanates

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Its mud, blood and beer... She twists the dial again and we hear the bellows of a pr BETH (cont'd) Or God. BETH switches off the radio. SARAH stares out at the gloo dusk, oblivious. Suddenly an overhanging branch bangs against the windscre startling SARAH. BETH looks at her and stops the car at t of the road. There is that total, rural silence that acco for the in-breeding and the high suicide rate.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: We don’t have to do this you know. We can turn back, stay in town, get wasted and go to a barn dance.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Now that is frightening. A motorcycle zooms up out of nowhere, two shaven-headed l guys on it. As their headlights pick out the girls in the stationary car they scream and holler, the back passenger raising a clenched fist in salute. The noise and the bike swallowed up by the gathering darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: My kind of town. SARAH straightens up, pulling herself together

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You’re right. We don’t have to do this. But I’m not going to be the one to tell Juno... BETH smiles, relieved. She starts up the car and they con on their way.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: She’s a piece of work - she always drags us out to the middle of. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 14 12 BETH(cont 'd) She probably bribed someone to get Rebecca and Sam green cards just to make sure we stay on her turf.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She came to England last year.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (mutters) And she left pretty quickly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Beth...it’s no-one’s fault

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same car drives towards us and pulls over, its headli ECU. We pull back as they switch off and Sarah steps out passenger side. BETH gets out too, stretching. On the veranda in front of this log cabin JUNO waits for

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah! Beth! She strides towards them, radiant and confident as ever. sweeps SARAH into an embrace, catching BETH’s eye as she so. BETH looks back at her, cool.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno. JUNO holds Sarah’s face in her hands. She’s warm, intense compelling...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Everything’s going to be fine. Better it’s going to be great - go on in, Rebecca and Sam can’t wait to see you. She takes SARAH’s bag and pushes her towards the light an laughter. Once Sarah is out of earshot, JUNO looks at BET JUNO (cont'd) How is she?  13

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: She’s here. I wouldn’t push it any further than that. Picking up her bag she walks past Juno. BETH (cont'd) I'll look after her.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: It’s not a competition Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sure. And they head towards the door past a large window, throu which we can see women gathered around a roaring log fire drinking, talking and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca Van Ney (tall, athletic, Scandinavian, mid 20s) h arm around SARAH.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s so good to see you. So good. A smaller version of Rebecca runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Beth! Sarah! SARAH gets up to embrace her. It is clear from the expres her face that all the lights, the people, are slightly to for her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (quietly) Sam. Thank you for your letter, it meant a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I couldn’t be there. Mid- terms...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) Sarah, you know Sam’s going to be Doctor Van Ney in like, a year’s time!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Please tell me it’s longer.  10.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I’m going to fix us some drinks - Sarah, come help me? But Sarah is staring into the fire, distracted. JUNO shru walks off. SAM laughs at BETH.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I can treat your arthritis now if you like. I hear it all starts falling apart past twenty-five... BETH swipes at her playfully...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Can anyone make me feel any older? And in walks HOLLY, about 18, in skate clothes, with ring everywhere and spiky hair, smoking some home-grown. She i incredibly attractive.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (european accent) Hello. You are the teacher friend, yes?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Great. Just put me in a rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: This is Holly. Juno’s...protege.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (mutters) I always thought Juno would eat her young. Rebecca laughs

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (SHARP )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a little bit tough for that I think.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’ve heard all about you. You’re the crazy one who jumps off buildings.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Base jumping. Buildings, yes. It is illegal. But a high.  14 15 11. She waves her joint and all the girls laugh, tensions dissolving. HOLLY smiles at SARAH.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, (CONT)
dialogues.text: I like your short hair. It’s better than before. Juno showed me photos of when you used to climb together

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (at Sarah’s shoulder) Plus I found this classic, from our first ever trip. She hands SARAH an old slightly battered photo. It shows teenage girls - JUNO, SARAH and BETH - with their arms ar each other, elated, against a blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: God. Check the hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lodge, its windows lit up, looks invitingly warm agai forbidding backdrop of the vast forest. We can vaguely se women enjoying themselves inside, the sound of their laug and conversation fading on the breeze. We HOLD on this fo moment and then very slowly begin to TRACK IN on the wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are sitting around, relaxed. A large number of wine bottles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What happened to Josh, Sam, are you guys still together?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Kind of, sort of. Different shifts...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What about you Holly?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m like Juno, you know, the sport fuck? Rebecca too I think? But when I am an old lady maybe twenty-four twenty-five I have babies...  12. There is an awkward silence. Rebecca squeezes SARAH’s han HOLLY (cont'd) What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (calm) I had a child. She died. A year ago. Holly looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Shit. Juno told me about your husband but I didn’t... No-one can think of anything to say. JUNO fills the silen

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) So Rebecca and I are going into business. We’ve set up a company.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: A company? How very...conventional of you Juno.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s a women-only outward-bound centre. We’re going to do trips all over the country - climbing, caving, skydiving, surfing... She stretches her impossibly long legs. REBECCA (cont'd) There’s a real market for women who don’t want the bullshit that comes with a mixed group.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (teasing; of Rebecca) Well, there’s the gear freaks. Those guys who have to have the latest gadget and use it all the time. No room for instinct. Rebecca laughs, realizing that Juno’s comment is directed her. She continues the joke  16 17 13.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (of Holly) And the peak-baggers - they don’t care where they are; it’s just about whether they’ve got to the top of enough of them...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (of Juno) And the guys who’ve got to be the leader; who’ve got to hold the map and want to turn the whole thing into the army. I’ve had them.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (to Sam) And the guys who make you the baby of the group even if you’ve done more than them.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (to Holly) See? You just don’t get that bullshit with women. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA and JUNO are padding around preparing for the mor REBECCA has an impeccably tidy pile of gear at the foot o bed. JUNO a pile of clothes and a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY is lying on her bed while SAM packs. A low lamp is burning. HOLLY is in a very brief T-shirt with ‘KILL ALL HIPPIES’ on it, and SAM is in PJs. They are pretty drunk. HOLLY has a crappy mini stereo playing tinny surf/punk mu She is smoking a joint and swigging from a hip flask that passes to SAM.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: So you go on trips with all these girls before?  18 19 14.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Just once. Juno started them when she was at school in England, and then picked up Rebecca when she moved back here.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Why go on holiday with your sister? You don’t want to meet guys?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well, I’ve got a guy. HOLLY picks up a photo of her boyfriend which is by the b SAM (cont'd) Have you been to Boreham Caverns?

dialogues.speaker: HOLY
dialogues.text: I see it in a book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking past the bedroom JUNO overhears. HOLLY (0.S.) (cont'd) ...It’s Starbucks, you know - hand rails, tourist things...it’s not adventure. Juno lingers by the door, eavesdropping...

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: If you are a climber, jumper, caver you have to just do it and not give a fuck or the thing that is bigger than you will get you. SAM pats HOLLY’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think that weed might be bigger than you Holly. HOLLY hands the photo back to SAM  20 21 22 23 24 25 15.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You are lucky. He looks like a bad boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO walks away looking pissed off, bumping into REBECCA clearly overheard as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH is asleep. SARAH is in her bed awake, staring, glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind whistles through the trees and the moon lights u night as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH is still awake. She gets up and goes to look out of window, her eyes straining in the dark. Through the trees can see a flicker of light, a flash of yellow, and on the she hears the giggle of a child. SARAH presses her head a the window, the cold condensation easing the pounding in head and SMASH - A scaffolding pole comes straight through it impaling its her head and spurting blood everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she awakens bolt upright in her bed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus...  26 27 28 29 30 16. She falls back heavily on the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very early. The sky is a leaden grey, with a pale yellow on the horizon. All is still.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Feet, jogging. We tilt up to reveal JUNO as she runs to t LODGE, leaps up the steps onto the veranda and into the l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno breezes in to her room.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Wakey wakey! REBECCA is sitting up in bed, wearing sunglasses, and loo severely hung-over.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I feel like roadkill. ...Give me five minutes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA wanders into the bathroom, turns on the shower fu blast and COLD, removes her gown and steps in. She scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream can be heard from next door as BETH stands bef mirror in her bathroom looking rough, checking her bloods eyes. She sticks her tongue out. Checks her breath....It’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a foot reflected in the mirror. It lowers and anot comes up. HOLLY the human rubber band is stretching. ANGLE on view from Holly’s bathroom window: JUNO is stret on the porch, lithe and sinuous. But not a rubber band. H watching her. Holly’s face pops up in the mirror, smiling, with first o by her ear -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: The Queen is dead... And then the other.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Long live the queen. And she sticks her tongue out at herself in glee.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT BEDROOM 2. DAWN 34
dialogues.text: REBECCA is walking past the door, drying her hair with a as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Sam, are you up yet? And you ought to eat something. SAM puts the last pieces of equipment in her pack.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (mutters) Its just for the weekend. It’1ll be good for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA walks past sees SARAH knock back some pills and g as she swallows, dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY is at the bottom of the steps, setting up a camera of the JEEPS parked up front.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Alright ladies....group shot! The others begin to assemble on the steps, carrying PACKS with kit. There is an edgy, fragile, hung-over vibe comin everyone except JUNO and HOLLY. BETH comes out last, look pissed off and anxious. REBECCA is fiddling with SAM’S ki SARAH is looking distractedly at the rather jaundiced daw is now breaking. BETH sighs.

dialogues.speaker: OK...
dialogues.text: She smiles directly at BETH. HOLLY (cont’d) The Americans will find this bit hard: say Liberty! And she runs round to join them... HOLLY (cont’d) Equality! And flings herself into their midst. HOLLY (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: SORORITY
dialogues.text: CLICK, the picture is taken and the image freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out over the vastness of the landscape, WE tilt d gliding above the sprawling canopy of trees until we pick trail of a forest road, following its snake-like course u find TwO 4x4’s making their way into this bleak wildernes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO is driving, with SARAH beside her and BETH in the ba It’s bumpy. SARAH is gazing out of the window, distant, h vision slightly blurred. A streak of yellow out of the corner of her eye - she tur head quickly but there’s nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA is driving with SAM beside her and HOLLY filming journey on her CAM-CORDER.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Here, you should drink some water. SAM Grabs the bottle, distracted by fiddling with her pla retro Spiderman watch.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s impossible to set the time on this thing; the buttons are too tiny. HOLLY smirks in the back. She finds a mountaineering maga with REBECCA’S name printed on a label on the cover. It’s of glossy crampons, over elaborate tents, geek gear etc.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (to herself) American porn.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So have you done these caves?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No - but they’re level 2, quite safe don’t worry.  41 42 43 20.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: The only danger is the boredom. Boreham caves, boredom caves

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Let’s go off road!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (Looking as if she may be sick) Oh let’s. The 4x4 swerves at speed, turning off the road onto a dir heading deep into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: EXT _- FOREST ROAD
dialogues.text: The second vehicle follows the first, at speed, kicking u cloud of dust as it swerves radically onto the dirt track

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO is pushing the vehicle hard as she races through the landscape. SARAH looks a little uneasy about JUNO’s drivi doesn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is the right way?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Been here before Beth? The 4x4 charges round another bend, throwing up dirt in i wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see various shots of the two vehicles driving hard alo rough and ready mountain track. They round a tight bend a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front wheel of the first 4X4 comes to an abrupt halt.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The second 4x4 bears down upon the first 4x4, veering aro hitting the brakes and skidding in the mud as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its occupants lurch forward as they grind to a halt along the first 4x4.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: ...nice parking

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I take it we’re walking from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a rapid series of shots depicting the women gettin kit together, sorting their packs, picks and boots out. We see JUNO put her CAR KEYS behind the SUN VISOR, before pulling out her own pack and strapping it on.  50 22.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Let’s get moving. We’re running late. She slams the door closed, and as they head off, we look and see a dog-eared PAPERBACK BOOK lying on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trekking upward through the forest, led by JUNO. BETH and bring up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where’s your whistle? Beth smiles and pulls out an old whistle that is tucked i top, brandishing it with a flourish. She gives it a coupl loud toots and shouts out:

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (taking the piss) Hey Juno, you DO know where you’re going don’t you? SARAH laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (terse) There’s a river about half a mile ahead. When we reach it, we follow it up to the mouth of the cave. SAM, near the back, turns to REBECCA.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: How does she know there’s a river up ahead? I can’t hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (dead pan) She can smell it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: ...She came up here last week to check the route out. Rule number one; file a flight plan and stick to it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And rule number 2?  51 52 53 23.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Don’t go wandering off. You think it’s dark when you turn out the lights? Down there it’s pitch black.

dialogues.speaker: 35EXT. MOUNTAIN RIVER. DAY 52
dialogues.text: White water crashes down this narrow gully. Rebecca is st lecturing

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You can get dehydration disorientation, claustrophobia, panic attacks, paranoia, hallucinations, visual and aural... Sam rolls her eyeballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO, up front, pushes through into a clearing. CROWS scatter and burst up into the air in a wild flurry. rotting corpse of a giant ELK lies washed up on the rocks huge bulk deflated and gaunt, its fur matted with blood a HOLLY takes pictures of the dead creature as the others g around, some looking on with interest, others with disgus

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Cool, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Lovely. A real Kodak moment. SAM bends down to take a closer look

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Don’t touch it!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yeah. You wouldn’t want to piss it off.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you think did that Sam? A bear?  54 55 24. SAM examines it and we see that its eyes are yellow.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Actually, I think it was just sick. SAM (cont’d) Jaundice, dengue fever, yellow fever..there’s all sorts of ways it could have died out here

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: What is this, Nature Detectives? It could have been Bigfoot for all you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuing on their trek, they climb up the side of a wat to a rocky area above. Deviating from the course of the r JUNO takes them through a stand of trees.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: This is it! Fighting through the heavy foliage, JUNO emerges at the e a great SINKHOLE, a gaping black opening in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Oh, you are having a laugh!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: ‘Fraid not.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: For Christ’s sake! I’m an English teacher not Tomb Raider. They are high up now, the mountains stretch out behind th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up at the daylight from the depths of the cave, t of three ropes drops toward us, straightening as it comes hitting rock beneath us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All six women are fully kitted out. Some are wearing warm figure hugging climbing tops and leggings. JUNO is wearin wet-suit top with the arms cut off. They have lamps on th helmets, extra torches in their packs, along with flares, food and water and their PICKS. JUNO is ready to go down and leans back over the brink.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I’1l go first. I’1l see you down there. Turning on her HEADLAMP she drops away into the unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the beam of her lamp flashing this way and that, JUN descends a hundred feet or more into the cavern, before f hitting rock bottom. Unhooking herself from the rope she around with a child-like glee before calling up to the ot

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You’ve got to see this place It’s beautiful! Her voice echoes and resonates about the massive chamber. looks around, awestruck. Now she is truly in her element.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAVE ENTRANCE. DAY/DARK 59
dialogues.text: REBECCA double checks SARAH and BETH’s harnesses and they down together, side by side.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Oh shit, oh shit, oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming down the rope, SARAH looks around in amazement bef landing safely near JUNO. BETH is just behind her...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You can open your eyes now, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Oh my God! TI had no idea it would be like this!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s incredible. Incredible. JUNO smiles in quiet satisfaction as from high above come loud WHOOP! They look up as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA looks down on US as we descend into the cave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY comes down the rope at high speed, her CAM-CORDER a to her helmet, howling all the way! At the last moment sh herself and lands like a cat in front of JUNO and SARAH SARAH shakes her head in dismay as JUNO steps in

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (angry) Holly, this isn’t some MTV bungee jump bullshit. We do this safely. In order. Following my lead.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to REBECCA) All clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca fusses over Sam’s harness. SAM drops down and REB follows her over the brink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA overtakes SAM and lands softly, unhooking herself the rope before SAM lands beside her. HOLLY is filming th with her CAMCORDER. JUNO stands beneath a steady drip of water, the light fro surface shining down on her upturned face, soaking her br

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah? SARAH is looking at what appears to be recent scratch mar the side of the rock, as if some animal had fallen into t cavern and was making a desperate attempt to claw its way to the surface. Her attention is drawn to a dark crevice cave wall, from which a quiet chirping noise is coming. S moves closer to the hole, listening carefully.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Guys, I think I’ve found a bird’s nest! The others turn to her as SARAH turns her attention back HOLE, aiming her TORCHBEAM into the shadows. Suddenly, th erupts with BATS! Hundreds of them, swarming out and arou very panicky SARAH. A hand grabs her and pulls her clear. Juno, nonplussed by the BATS.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: It’s Okay...they’re gone now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Take a look for yourself. SARAH looks upwards to see the BATS swirling around the f of the cave entrance in an elegant spiral. After the shoc an eerie yet beautiful sight.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: The butterflies of the night...  28.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Oh fuck off Holly. From a high vantage point, we watch the group make their downwards, into the cave.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Only one way out of this chamber. Down the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water dripping from the rocks all around the ENTRANCE CAV gathers at its lowest point and flows into a crack in the floor. This is where our intrepid CAVERS must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in a narrow, vertical shaft with plenty of footh all the way down. The water drips heavily down the side o shaft, as the women head deeper into the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further down the tunnel levels off to a shallow downward With each step the tunnel randomly fluctuates in size and sometimes it’s tall and very thin, sometimes it’s wide an so that they must stoop or even crawl to pass through, an the way water drips from the roof above their heads.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Exhausted. But don’t tell Rebecca. They laugh together as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see various shots of the group making their way deeper deeper into the cave system until at last they emerge int vast chamber and we

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: ....For THIS we need a little more light on the subject. JUNO takes out one of the many PHOSPHOROUS FLARES they ha lights it up. Now the chamber is filled with a hot white throwing hard shadows of countless stalactites across the The roof and floor of this new cavern are littered with g stalagmites and stalactites, pillars of rock formed over millions of years; sediment building upward and downward some of them bridge the entire cap. The colour of the new is yellow with sulphur and red with iron. The entire cham an amazing spectacle. The group spread out as they enter this grand subterranea cathedral, almost gothic in its design, each of them eage explore their own corner of the cave. From a HIGH LEDGE, we look down on the group, spread arou chamber: Six individual pools of light, moving here and t In the centre, the FLARE burns steadily. In the right foreground, we become aware that what we tho was a rock, is in fact something else, SOMETHING ALIVE, m slightly. Breathing. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: Five members of the group are having a bite to eat and so to drink as HOLLY snaps away with her camera beyond them. JUNO (cont’d) Holly, take a break, you should eat!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m just getting a couple more shots. This cave is cooler than I thought.  30.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) ...You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno. I won’t break.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (quietly) I know... I wanted to say - there’s nothing I can say. But I’m sorry I didn’t stay around longer. After the accident. She sighs, its the first time we’ve seen her anything oth in control. JUNO (cont'd) I’m bad with that stuff. And Paul...You know.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (SOFT)
dialogues.text: And Jessie... SARAH and JUNO share a look...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: We’re all here for you now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ...I’m sorry. I’m a bit out of it...It’s probably jet-lag or something. SARAH gets up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m going to have a look around.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: See if you can find the way through.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (calling out) Don’t go too far. SARAH picks up her torch and moves past HOLLY, who has be observing her and JUNO’s exchange.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: ...She flips out?  70 31.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: She’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: After the crash she broke down pretty badly. Spent months in hospital. She was a mess. Couldn’t find a reason to get up in the mornings.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Well, I guess she found one if she’s here.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Elsewhere in the cavern, SARAH skirts the bright light so the flare, moving among the harsh shadows of stalactite a stalagmites it creates. The sound of water dripping echoe around her, the voices of the others are a murmur. She is in her surroundings, fascinated by the cave. SARAH hears a noise, she spins and aims her TORCH. A rock from a ledge and bounces down scree slope, clattering to ground. SARAH, moves forward investigating, curious. There is an in the cave wall. SARAH listens, intent - the sound of la

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SARAH appears suddenly at JUNO’s shoulder, startling her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think I’ve found the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end of the chamber, the walls converge to meet base of a small heap of scree. At the top of the scree is narrow fissure. It is into this that the women must now g gather before the scree.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand - it’s not how imagined it from reading the book.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Caves change, tunnels collapse, some of this debris looks recent.  32.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Well then should we be going through?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, it’s a tight squeeze for about a hundred feet and then...

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Then it opens out into a wider passage.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: If you say so. It’s your party.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s nothing. ...Where’s Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know, she was here a minute ago... SAM? And again, that giggle, high pitched, child like. She loo around but its clear the others haven’t heard. The others spread out and look for her, calling for Sam. echoes bounce back. After a tense moment, a voice comes f behind a rock.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’M BUSY! The group all laugh at SAM’S predicament

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I made her drink loads of water this morning...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’1l wait for her. HOLLY worms her way ahead in front of JUNO

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I will take point yes?  71 72 73 74 33. HOLLY discards a half-eaten CANDY BAR and heads into the hooked onto a rope, which JUNO feeds in after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY edges further and further into the fissure. As the funnel inward, she must first stoop, then crawl, then lie and wriggle into this tiny passageway through the rock.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Phut! It’s tight crack in here. BETH looks apprehensive as she shines her torch along the crawl-way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY crawls head first through this intensely claustroph passage, barely big enough for her to move, contorting he through the most awkward spaces imaginable. Slowly but su she edges through, until at last the CRAWL SPACE opens ou she emerges in another tunnel, this time with high slopin and a sloping floor running diagonally along its length. HOLLY quickly turns about and part-crawls back into the H

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: OK I’m through!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Maybe 100-150 feet..

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Close enough?  75 76 77 78 34.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: ....Close enough. JUNO heads into the fissure as REBECCA turns to the other REBECCA (cont’d) Alright. Sam you’re up next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see each character’s progress through a difficult and constrictive space. JUNO is next through, then SAM, then REBECCA, then BETH and finally SARAH, bringing up the rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FLARE burns in the background as, in the immediate foreground, a silhouetted hand, humanoid, reaches down an up the half eaten CANDY BAR. Off screen, whatever it is, the CANDY and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO crawls out to join HOLLY, then helps SAM out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA squeezes through the tightest part, not noticing dust falling from the rock above. BETH is next through. It’s very tight, but she makes it. dust falls from the rocks above her head.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah, you still behind me?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (breathing hard) I think so...  79 80 35. SARAH seems to be having more difficulty than the others is the most uncomfortable in such a claustrophobic enviro Still, she shuffles along as best she can until she reach point at which, to get through, her head must twist to on and half submerge in a pool of muddy water. It is here th wedges herself stuck and can no longer move forward. The she fights, the more dust falls down from the roof inches her head, hitting her face. SARAH (cont’d) Shit. ....Shit! At first she’s just agitated and annoyed, but soon she be panic. She begins to breathe heavily and fast, the muddy getting in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (getting desperate) I can’t move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA is pulled out as JUNO begins to explore the caver are in.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH stops, waiting for SARAH..

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It’s Sarah. I think she might be stuck.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There’s no ‘might be’ about it. ..Fuck! FUCK! FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Alright Sarah....Calm down. Breathe slowly. You have to relax.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I can’t fucking relax!  81 82 36.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (slow and calming) Sarah....Listen to me. You have to calm down. The only way you can do that is to breathe slowly...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (panicking, hyperventilating) I’ve got a million tons of rock above my head! How the fuck am I supposed to calm down?! I can’t fucking BREATHE! The more she struggles, the more dust rains down on her. in a wider part of the fissure, manages to turn herself a and crawls back toward SARAH.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah, just listen to me, okay, listen to my voice....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY, at the far end, wants to know what’s keeping every

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s okay down there?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (calling back) We’re fine. Just give us a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH, now face to face with SARAH, continues to try and c SARAH down as her panic attack grows more desperate. She splutters and gags with the mud in her mouth and writhes the rock, wedging herself even further. BETH can see the dust falling from the rock above and kno danger SARAH is in. She focuses completely on her, soothi magnetic:

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah listen to me. What are you afraid of?  37.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (agitated) I can’t move...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You can. You can move. It’s in your head.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (WHISPERS)
dialogues.text: I know, I know, but I can’t stop it.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah, the worst thing that can happen to you has already happened. SARAH, despite herself, is distracted...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It’s over. And you’re here. You didn’t give up. This is just a poxy little cave. You’ve got NOTHING left to be afraid of. SARAH begins to calm down...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I want you to crawl toward me. Slowly. SARAH complies, edging toward BETH until she feels hersel becoming unstuck. BETH (cont'd) Take it slow.... Okay...okay...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m almost out... SARAH uses her feet against the wall to push herself the foot or so, but with one final push her boot kicks away s rock, and the ceiling of the cave suddenly drops about 2 toward both their heads...but stops! SARAH and BETH freeze in horror. There is a moment’s hesi then BETH acts.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Fuck! Alright, MOVE! NOW!  83 84 85 86 38. She grabs SARAH’s collar and heaves her free, then the tw them frantically race along the narrow fissure, the roof cracking, threatening to collapse on them at any moment. SARAH glances behind her, into the darkness, which seems chasing her along the fissure! From the darkness comes a terrifying SHRIEK and then it gives, collapsing on the sp where SARAH was trapped. But the cave-in continues, following them along the fissu gaining on them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO knows exactly what’s happening as REBECCA grabs her pulls her away from the fissure.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah?!!! Beth?!!! A cloud of dust erupts from the entrance to the fissure, FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Candles. A cake. Jessie, in a yellow party dress, la

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sarah...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah....? SARAH                        !  39. JUNO’s helmet lamp shines on SARAH’s face as she comes ar coughing and spluttering on the water REBECCA is giving h air is still full of dust and around her, the others are themselves up. BETH (cont'd) Are you alright? Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (a little shocked) I’m alright. Torch beams flash this way and that. Everyone is choking, disoriented, shocked and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Is everybody okay? IS EVERYBODY OKAY?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Samantha?!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m here. REBECCA grabs her baby sister and clutches her tightly SAM (cont’d) (firmly) I’M OKAY.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Beth, are you injured?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No. ....I don’t think so. REBECCA checks her over, comforting her as best she can.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Everybody stay close until this dust settles.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We’re not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: seen You are right about that. SARAH gets to her feet as all eyes, and torch beams fall spot HOLLY is looking at: The fissure is completely block  40.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Jesus. They fall silent, taking in the implications.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: So what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Well...according to the guide book this cave system has three ways in and out. This is just one of them. Isn’t that right Juno? JUNO has turned away from the them.... REBECCA (cont’d) (pressing her for an answer) Juno, that’s right, isn’t it? Check the book! JUNO turns around, awkwardness and defiance etched on her

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I didn’t bring it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: No point.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean? What does she mean? REBECCA knows exactly what she means. SARAH has distanced herself from the group, she stares out into the darkness,

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: For Chrissakes Juno. I knew it..I knew this wasn’t right!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Oh come on Rebecca, this is what we’ve believed in for ten years! If there’s no risk, what’s the point? We may as well stay at home and watch fucking TV...

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Don’t you try and justify this! I KNOW why you did this...  41. And she waves her torch irritably, catching HOLLY in its obliviously exploring their surroundings. Behind her the argument rages as SARAH sweeps her TORCH B across the cavern. She catches something bright in the be just for a fleeting moment, something HUMANOID, looking b her. By the time she registers this and sweeps the TORCH back to the spot, it’s gone. She looks around, to see if anyone else saw it, but they too self-absorbed.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, we have food and water. We have a fuck-off cave to explore...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (to Rebecca) You filed a flight plan with mountain rescue? If we don’t report in they’1l come looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (glaring at Juno) That’s how it’s supposed to work except I put in a plan for Boreham Caverns, and this isn’t Boreham Caverns, is it Juno?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (incredulous) We’re in the wrong fucking cave?!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You all wanted to go caving, well this is caving! Holly was right. Boreham Caverns is a tourist trap.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: This isn’t caving Juno. This is an ego trip.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So where are we?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Juno?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn’t have a name; it’s a new system. Nobody’s ever been down here before.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (to Juno) How are we going to get out!?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (matter of factly) There may not BE a way out. 42. JUNO is walking around frantically examining every nook a cranny. BETH follows her, furious.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (hisses) What the hell are you doing? What do you think this is going to do to Sarah? How much more do you think she can take - not that you’d know what she’s been through because you couldn’t get away fast enough...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (snaps) You know what Beth? We all lost something in that crash.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Oh bullshit. What did you lose? JUNO starts to speak, but bites her words back. BETH is o and shines the torch right in her face BETH (cont'd) What did you lose Juno? JUNO’S face says it all. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Do I have to spell it out? BETH absorbs this. She looks at JUNO in disgust, torch right on her BETH (cont'd) Just get us out of here. keeping the  87 43. JUNO turns and walks back to the others in an effort to r control.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: We have to go on. Cave systems often break ground. It’s a small chance....If we stay here, we’1l die. Slowly, the women pick up their PACKS and other gear, pre to move off. SARAH stands apart from the others, staring the darkness, hoping for another glimpse to put her mind ease. The darkness is taking hold.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Never mind...it’s nothing....

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: tee I promise you, I’m going to get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO leads the way down a steep slope of jagged rocks and boulders. Around them grows a low rumble, and the steady and splash of falling water. JUNO scans the area, checking on the others, while SAM, e press on, overtakes her and moves toward US.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (Shouts) Stop! SAM stops dead, and everyone else does too.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: DON’T MOVE! Just stay there! JUNO, takes off her pack and removes a FLARE, quickly str it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it reveals is that the floor drops away beneath SAM’ A RAVINE, about 20 feet across, and so deep they can’t se bottom, but can hear the rumbling from far below.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Underground river.... SAM picks up a rock and drops it over the edge; a long, l pause; then a distant clattering and a splash. REBECCA (cont'd) » now I know how far down it is.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Well somebody has to cross first, and that’s my job. JUNO strikes up a FLARE and throws it across the chasm, w strikes the wall and lands on a ledge, highlighting anoth ledge and cleft in the rockface. A possible way through.. REBECCA stares at the ravine and the ceiling above them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: How does it look?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What does it matter? There’s no alternative.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: There’s a crack, running right across the roof.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I see it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: How does that help?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I have to get all the way across so I can rig a line for you guys. So, I go hand over hand, put my hand in the crack, clench my fist and hang on.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You’ve done this before, right?  45.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I saw a guy do it once. An instructor. On an artificial wall over a block of crash-mats. SAM is apprehensive on her sister’s behalf. The OTHERS lo REBECCA with a mixture of hope and admiration. All except who is already rigging a safety-rope for REBECCA. REBECCA attaches the rope to her harness and pulls on hea leather GLOVES - flexing her fists. At this end, the crack is low enough to reach. She tries Puts her fist in. Clenches. Swings her feet off the floor hangs by one arm. REBECCA begins her perilous free-style crossing of the ca roof, hand over hand, wedging her fist into the fissure a hanging by it. She’s hooked onto a safety line which she attaches to PITONS along the way. She is now hanging directly above the chasm! It is an inc feat of stamina, muscle power and raw physical grit. Swin from hand to hand, finding the best purchase, swapping he weight from one hand to the other, then doing it all agai foot at a time, at most. Every so often, stopping, taking PITON from her belt, placing it in the narrow crack, atta CARABINA and hooking on her safety line, all whilst hangi one hand! Slowly, terrifyingly edging her way toward the far side.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: HOLLY films her all the way, as best she can in the given

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Passing the halfway point, REBECCA stops dead. Something ahead has her absolute attention. It is a PITON, an old one, hammered into the fissure, inv to the others, but clear enough to her as evidence that s at some time, has passed this way before. But she pauses long and JUNO senses something is up.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Nothing!  88 46. Their voices echo around the cavern. REBECCA glances back JUNO and their eyes meet. It’s a knowing glance, but JUNO fully aware of what she’s supposed to know. REBECCA (cont’d) I’m alright! REBECCA turns back to the job at hand. In order to disgui PITON, rather than raise unnecessary questions or concern the minds of the rest of the team, she hooks a CARABINA t just as she’s done to the others she’s placed. Two more swings and she’s reached the far side. She drops onto the ledge above the one with the FLARE on it. Beyond ledge is a tall but narrow crack in the rock, just big en for them to squeeze through. REBECCA quickly hammers in a final PITON and secures a SA LINE, before hooking herself on. REBECCA (cont’d) Throw me the line! JUNO steps up to the edge of the drop and hurls a coiled across to REBECCA. Unfurling as it goes, REBECCA leans ou the bottomless drop to catch the flailing end of the rope hand! She succeeds, and very calmly ties it on to a secur PITON, pulling the rope taut across the canyon. REBECCA (cont’d) Alright, who’s first?! SAM steps forward

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’1l go. SAM attaches the CARABINA of her SAFETY HARNESS to the TR LINE, and an extra CARABINA to the SAFETY LINE strung acr roof of the CAVERN. Now, using the SAFETY LINE to pull he across while the TRAVERSE LINE holds her weight, SAM make way across the roof of the CANYON CAVERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopping along the way to unclip and re-clip her SAFETY L she passes each of three PITONS along the route, she soon it to the other side and is pulled onto the ledge by REBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY is next across and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then BETH goes. She reaches the OLD PITON, hammered into the rock, and wh passes it, the strain on the rope causes it to jar in its lodging. Just a little, but enough to warrant our concern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO and SARAH remain on the far side. JUNO checks she’s on properly, and sends SARAH her across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she reaches the middle, the OLD PITON begins to move a With each tug it works its way loose. SARAH manages to successfully pass it without dislodging It’s not long before she’s reached the other side and REB pulls her up beside her, where BETH is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO hooks on and begins her traverse. Ahead of her the OLD PITON looks dangerously loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH stands behind BETH, looking into the cleft, before back in dreamlike SLO MO to look back at JUNO crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning the TRAVERSE LINE, which REBECCA is gripp tightly for safety, comes loose from the rock. The full w of JUNO suddenly dropping pulls it through REBECCA’s palm burning through her glove and tearing open the palm of he

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno!!! REBECCA cries out in agony and BETH grabs hold of the rop JUNO’s harness now pulls taut, suspended from the SAFETY REBECCA wails in agony as JUNO hangs there momentarily, l up at the SAFETY LINE. Now the OLD PITON gives way, pulling free from the rock a dropping JUNO another ten feet toward her doom. But now t and pitons hold fast. SAM and BETH are holding the line.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It’s alright! We’ve got you! JUNO can only look up in bemusement as the OLD PITON slid the SAFETY LINE toward her. She grabs it, looks at it, th looks up toward the pained face of REBECCA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH, BETH and SAM pull JUNO up onto the ledge with them immediately goes over to attend to REBECCA’s injured hand places the OLD PITON and CARABINA in SARAH’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: It means we’re not the first.  97 98 49.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: If there’s been other cavers down here, then there’s more of a chance...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: This equipment’s got to be a hundred years old. No-one uses stuff like this any more. Besides, if people had been down here, they’d have given it a name.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Maybe they never made it out... SAM has bandaged REBECCA’s hand. This has stopped the ble but it is difficult to use now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women are at the mouth of a winding, narrow tunnel. T a sense of real trepidation about them now.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Holly? How does it look?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s tight but it opens out.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Alright, keep going, we’ll be right behind you. They all squeeze through the narrow cleft and soon it ope into a strange sloping, angular cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY is the first out of the cleft, and as she enters th cavern, something immediately catches her eye. We don’t s it is, but she stands there, staring past us....

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Hey! There’s something down here!  50. One by one the others join her. Standing alongside of eac shining torches and headlamps past US, gazing in awe and wonderment at...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CAVE PAINTINGS. The beams of the torches pick out fragmen larger image. Ancient depictions of man and beast. Hunter their prey. Figures of humans, standing at the mouth of a Across to the right there is a reversal of the image, sim but different, again showing the mouth of a cave. BETH is fascinated by it, she moves closer, studying this prehistoric record in greater detail.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (TO HERSELF)
dialogues.text: It’s like a mirror painting, two images, but they’re one... JUNO steps into BETH’S light.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: What is this? History class?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (snaps) ..Wait a minute....! BETH has seen something new in the CAVE PAINTING as she b away from it, trying to take it all in, past the others..

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Beth? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Juno... light up one of those flares

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Why? What do you see? BETH (cont’d) (glaring at Juno) JUST LIGHT THE FUCKING FLARE. JUNO reluctantly strikes up a WHITE flare and holds it up illuminating the entire wall of the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: tenes Look at it. What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s many paintings?  99 51.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No, one big painting. It’s the mountain, it’s the forest, it’s the cave. And - it has two entrances.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Beth you’re a fucking genius!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This means there’s a way out?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Let’s find out. They are off, renewed hope has quickened the pace a littl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO is holding the FLARE and leading the way, the others behind, getting faster and faster, as the tunnel winds th and that until they round a bend, and the tunnel opens ou splits into THREE! JUNO, stops dead, the momentum lost.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Shit. SHIT! The others gather round. JUNO (cont'd) Who’s got a lighter? I need to check the breeze. HOLLY fumbles through her pocket... finds her lighter and it to JUNO, who takes each tunnel in turn, standing at it entrance holding the lighter and seeing if there is a bre sucking air through. The first does nothing. The second does nothing. But at t third the lighter flickers..

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: That’s the one! At that she takes off down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Holly wait! .......... Damn it!  52. They set off after HOLLY, but she’s away and hurrying ahe them, faster and faster until something catches her eye. stops, turning off the light in her helmet and her torch. Up ahead, in the pitch darkness, she can just make out a blue glow. DAYLIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Daylight! I see daylight! Before others can catch up, she is off and running again, time without any lights on! Using the DAYLIGHT to guide h But when she rounds the bend and sees it isn’t daylight a but LUMINESCENT ALGAE growing on the wall, the floor drop beneath her! It’s a SINKHOLE and she slides uncontrollabl the slippery rock toward the brink. JUNO quickly arrives at the scene with the FLARE and dive toward where HOLLY was last standing. She lunges toward t of the SINKHOLE, where the slippery rock forms an angled in the floor of the cave. She jams her shoulder against a rock and winces. HOLLY (cont’d) Help me! JUNO just manages to grab her hand, but HOLLY’s fingers a covered in slime, making it impossible to hold on. JUNO i pressed against the rock which is cutting her arm. HOLLY going. First her hand slips...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Don’t move! ...then her fingers pull from JUNO’s grasp as HOLLY slide slowly, relentlessly down into the funnel. There are coun other scratch marks around her. She’s not the first to sl down here. She can only look back at JUNO, helpless, out reach, as gravity works against her, pulling her down int unknown darkness below. She can’t help but move! SARAH and the others reach the edge in time to look down terrified HOLLY slides over the brink and disappears into SINKHOLE. JUNO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: There is a dull thud from below as HOLLY lands upon somet solid. JUNO looks at the others. All is not lost.  100 101 53. JUNO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: From below comes a faint sound of pain... It’s HOLLY. She alive.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: HOLLY is slowly becoming aware that she is in pain. Extre pain. She is lying in a narrow tunnel half in and half ou underground stream.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (to herself) Shit. Groaning she reaches down her leg to where the pain is gr and feels something protruding. HOLLY (cont'd) (calling to the others) I think I hurt my leg! Raising her head, she looks down, shining her HEAD LAMP o spot, to see her shin bone has broken and burst through t skin! The wound isn’t bleeding but muscle and sinews are out of her leg! She falls back, gasping for breath against the pain. HOLLY (cont’d) Please.. get down here....!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO is already on the case, bleeding shoulder and all, hammering in PITONS along with REBECCA as they prepare to and climb down into the SINKHOLE. JUNO and SAM rapidly abseil down through the SINKHOLE. RE BETH and SARAH are quick to follow.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This place is not good. We have to move you and it’s going to hurt like a son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) Alright, but make it quick...make it quick quick quick.... HOLLY is delirious with pain as SAM continues her work an and BETH arrive at the scene.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She’s going to be fine. SAM takes a sharp CLASP KNIFE from a sheath on her belt a it to cut open HOLLY’s trouser leg, revealing the true ex the wound.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (seeing the wound) Ah God! That is fucking disgusting!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Beth. Not here. Not now. We need help. Grab a corner. We need to move her out of the water. They all do as she bids. SAM cradling the broken leg as g as she can.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Nice and easy now..... lift. HOLLY groans as she’s slowly lifted out of the water and onto a rocky ledge. when she is put down the pain is unbe

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Ahh Jeeessussss!!!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Juno, pass me the first aid kit. And see if you find something to make a splint out of.  55. BETH takes some spare clothing from her PACK and places i HOLLY’s head as REBECCA and the others set to work bindin strapping the broken limb with the limited FIRST AID KIT have available. JUNO pulls the PICK from HOLLY’S RUCKSACK and unscrews th She intends to use the handle as a splint. REBECCA activates a couple of SNAP LIGHTS, filling the ar soft BLUE LIGHT. SARAH has also distanced herself from th others and is watching JUNO. Just then she hears a noise, faint, like a small rock falling, from somewhere upstream this DRAINAGE TUNNEL. REBECCA, BETH and SAM are too busy to HOLLY’s leg to take any notice. But JUNO and SARAH notice, and SARAH sets off down the tu cautiously, to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah, don’t wander off. (SARAH takes no notice) ....Sarah..?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Juno, I’m going to need your help here. JUNO is distracted by SARAH.... SAM (cont’d) Juno! JUNO joins the group around HOLLY. SAM (cont’d) Take hold of her arm, you’re going to need to hold her down.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I need to dress the wound and rig up a splint, but I can’t do that while the bone is protruding. I have to push it back in. HOLLY looks at her. Knows it has to be done. SAM (cont’d) Here, bite down on this.  103 104 105 56. SAM puts a leather strap between HOLLY’s teeth as REBECCA her legs and BETH and JUNO hold her arms, to stop her fla around and making it worse. HOLLY is already sweating as she bites down on the strap. SAM uses her fingers to open up the muscles and her thumb force the bone back into the leg! BETH cannot bear to loo HOLLY, biting down hard, screams in agony as we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH hears the scream, but continues regardless, explori deeper and deeper into this new network of tunnels. Looking around, something lying up ahead in the stream ca her eye. The beam of her HEAD LAMP reflects off an old MI HELMET wedged in a cleft. Picking it up she studies it. It is badly damaged but a n clearly painted in black on the front of it. ED OSWALD. Then she hears something else up ahead, something that so like the shriek of a bird. Or a child. She looks up...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: With one last effort SAM finally pushes the bone back int and through the searing pain HOLLY spits out the STRAP an in air. JUNO looks up toward the direction SARAH went in, and we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Searching the way with the beams of her TORCH and HEAD LA SARAH notices something very vague catching the light in distance. Whatever it is, it only stands out because it i lighter colour than the rock around it The closer she gets the more form it takes, but still it vague and unidentifiable. Is she seeing things? She begin doubt it herself.  106 57. She moves on, the shape appears to be moving. Step by ste grows ever closer, until the shape begins to take definit in the farthest reach of her torch light It looks human. It makes a sudden move then freezes, list SARAH starts, freezing herself, straining her eyes to see It is a figure, facing away from her, squatting low and h over, drinking from the water, its shoulders and head mov slightly. It is still very difficult to make out, but it incredibly gaunt and sinewy, pale yellowey white, and tot naked. SUDDENLY a hand grasps SARAH shoulder! She starts and spi around, almost blinding JUNO with her lights!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (anxious whisper) There’s something.. I saw a man....up ahead in the tunnel! She turns back and aims the torch along the tunnel, but i now empty.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: There’s nothing there. SARAH pointedly hands JUNO the helmet. She looks at it as heads back to join the others. JUNO watches her, concerne

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SAM has finished dressing HOLLY’s wound and uses the PICK as a SPLINT.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There. That’s the best I can do. It’ll hurt like hell and you won’t be able to put any weight on it, but you can move. REBECCA looks at her little sister with admiration. HOLLY as she tries moving her leg. JUNO and SARAH return, in the middle of an animated discu  58.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: tee It’s just old mining gear, Sarah. They combed these mountains for gold over a century ago! Anyone trapped down here would be a skeleton by now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (QUIET)
dialogues.text: ..that’s just what it looked like.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What WHAT looked like?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah thinks she saw somebody back there.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: She what?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t THINK I saw someone, I saw someone.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You heard something. You saw what you wanted to see. It’s the dark, it plays tricks. BETH is thinking along the same lines now, watching SARAH concerned eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There are things I want to see. That wasn’t one of them.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: A man. I saw a man.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes, and it’s not the first time. I thought I saw someone before. But now I’m sure. She looks around at five doubting faces SARAH (cont’d) ...really, I’m sure.  107 108 59. JUNO catches BETH’S eye.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah there’s no-one down here. Forget it. We have to get Holly out. All the women in the group know she’s right, even BETH wh SARAH an encouraging little nod of the head.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO strikes up the lighter and it flickers... This is th HOLLY is hopping along, in great pain, between BETH and S while SARAH, JUNO and REBECCA lead the way upstream.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: FURTHER UPSTREAM - They reach the bottom of a short water down which the stream bubbles from a larger chamber above JUNO is the first to go, followed by the others. She slow peers over the brink to look upon the scene laid out befo in wide eyed horror.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Water is constantly dripping from various parts of the ce forming the stream. But the chamber itself is flooded, ab foot deep, because the top of the waterfall is blocked by made out of BONES! Each of the team make it to the top to look upon this sce carnage with fear and amazement. Each of them scans the c of bones with their torch beams, picking out skulls and a SARAH spots a piece of clothing, shredded, perhaps belong the missing cavers. But there are no human remains here.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Looks like a slaughter house. SARAH approaches HOLLY....  109 60.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Holly, let me use your cam-corder, I want to see what I can see on infra- red. HOLLY hands it over, and SARAH scans the entire area with SARAH (cont’d) Dead animals. Hundreds of them. JUNO turns her torch to the rest of the cavern. It appear the centre of a honeycomb of tunnels leading off in every direction. Some carrying water to feed the stream, others

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: This is definitely not good.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (nervous) Can we get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Which way? JUNO is trying out the LIGHTER again, but the flame is flickering from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (a little panicked) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH flits the INFRA-RED CAMERA from face to face in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: The breeze is coming from all over the place. It could be any one of these tunnels. Take your pick.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (under her breath) ) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Hello? Is there anybody there?  110 61.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (contemptuous) Oh please...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Right now I’m willing to try anything..... HELLO?! When we return to BETH, we see another figure standing at shoulder. It’s vaguely human, very pale in the green of t INFRA-RED. It is totally hairless and gaunt. Its eyes app be sealed closed, and it has large mutated ears and a jaw distended to accommodate a mouthful of jagged teeth. In t darkness it appears ready to strike at BETH’s back, but w JUNO’s torch lights it up it rapidly retreats into the sh This thing is a STYGIAN CRAWLER and this is its lair.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Now they’ve all seen it and react in horror and shock. Torch lights flash around the chamber trying to pin-point strange apparition, but it’s too fast, darting left and r up and across the walls of the chamber, evading their att to get a good look of it. It’s just a pale, agile figure, darting this way and that, and letting rip a hideous, pie shriek as it goes! JUNO struggles to light a flare, and o strikes she holds it up to illuminate the whole CAVERN, b as quickly as it appeared, the CRAWLER is gone!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What was that?! WHAT THE FUCK WAS

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I could barely see, it moved so fast!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I told you we weren’t alone.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Fuck this. Let’s pick a tunnel and take our chances. BETH aids HOLLY as they head into the tunnel, but their p comes to a rapid halt as a terrible and unearthly sound f the tunnel ahead! It is a rasping, shrieking noise, and i coming their way...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: ...There’s more of them. They quickly back off and choose another tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: BETH and HOLLY are up front with JUNO bringing up the rea constantly looking back toward the ever advancing sound. HOLLY and BETH look behind as the shrieks grow noticeably louder, meaning whatever is making the noise has reached

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno?!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The flare! They can hear us! JUNO clocks the loud hissing of the FLARE, and thinks she have a point. The group pause as JUNO hurls the FLARE bac the tunnel toward the BONE DAM. BETH and HOLLY turn to face front once more only to run s into one of the CRAWLERS, its eyes wide, its jaw stretche open revealing it’s lethal fangs! It is humanoid, but far from human, and it shrieks wildly launches itself at HOLLY, the weakest of the team!

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: 112 113 114 63. The nature and ferocity of the attack cause the woman to in fear and run like Hell! They have no plan other than t away from this spot as fast as possible. In the chaos, RE and SAM flee in the opposite direction to SARAH and BETH they all soon become lost in the network of passageways. Behind them the hideous shrieking mingles with HOLLY desp garbled cries to form an appalling crescendo! And JUNO rises to the occasion, angry now, pulls out her an effort to defend HOLLY from the CRAWLER. The creature at HOLLY’s clothing and sinks its teeth into her neck, sh her writhing thrashing form like a rag doll! JUNO (cont'd) Leave her alone you fucker! She lashes out at the CRAWLER, cutting a gash down the si its face! The CRAWLER hisses at her angrily, as we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH leads the way as she and BETH flee the scene. But B stumbles and falls! By the time she looks up, SARAH has g

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SAM and REBECCA run and keep running, driven by fear.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Pick in hand, JUNO lunges again at the creature which is to drag HOLLY away. Shrieking at JUNO’s aggressive stance creature lashes out at her with sharpened, talon-like fin nails, ducking and writhing to avoid the swing of JUNO’s the two of them engage in a tug of war over HOLLY’s bleed body. The creature has her head and shoulders, while JUNO one hand on her ankle. But the creature is very strong an begins to lose her grip because of the thick gouts of blo oozing between her fingers. JUNO is spitting blood, in a violent rage, when a second lunges out of the darkness at her, grappling her to the g Still managing to hang on to HOLLY’s ankle, even with the CRAWLER on top of her, JUNO wages a furious war.  115 116 117 118 64. She hacks away at the CRAWLER as HOLLY is dragged away, s weakly struggling...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Panting and exhausted, REBECCA and SAM emerge into an unf CHAMBER. Realization dawns on SAM.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: BETH gets to her feet, disoriented, lost and afraid, not where SARAH has gone...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah....? She hears JUNO’s struggles echoing through the cave, draw attention....

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO watches horrified as HOLLY is dragged away by ‘SCAR’ CRAWLER she maimed. She smashes the pick into her attacke enough to get it off her as she scrambles after HOLLY, bu not long before the attacker leaps on her back, pulling h hair, trying to sink its teeth into her neck.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Still running, SARAH stumbles blindly in the darkness, th ground drops away beneath her and she slides down a long slippery gradient toward a precipice. She can’t stop. She falls, but only about ten feet, her head hitting the cold,wet stone with a sickening thud. She doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO rolls onto her back, on top of the CRAWLER, smashing head back into its face, before turning over, driving her into its solar-plexus and, with fury in her eyes, bringin pick down upon its head. This is pure uncontrolled rage a drives the sharp pick into the creature’s brain again and pummelling it to jelly until the CRAWLER finally stops twitching. Seething with adrenaline, grief and hate, JUNO sits atop kill, breathing deeply, sweating, shuddering. She stands, and takes a deep breath. Silence. Then, She s movement behind her. She whirls around, swinging the bloody pick toward her ne attacker!

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: It’s an uncontrolled, adrenaline-fuelled reaction and JUN face instantly turns from one of anger to one of stupefie horror as she finds BETH standing before her, looking at with a blank expression upon her face. Neither of them know quite what has happened until BETH d her knees, pulling JUNO with her because the point of her is embedded in BETH’s neck, and JUNO, in shock, can’t con her body enough to let go. Only as BETH slumps to the ground does the PICK finally c free. BETH is still alive, blood gushing from her neck. J staggers back, in horror at what she’s done! The sound of CRAWLERS shrieking before her, advancing, she must get ou there, and quickly. BETH looks at her incredulous, knowing what she is going She reaches out to JUNO, but JUNO backs off. It’s her or Law of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I can’t save you... BETH pants, desperate, hearing the crawlers, her hand to neck, sticky with her own blood

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You can help me..JUNO! FUCK YOU JUNO HELP ME YOU CAN’T LEAVE ME LIKE THIS!  120 121 122 66. JUNO backs away, turns and runs....

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: REBECCA and SAM come to a stop, listening to see if they being followed.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Stop....!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What happened to the others?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t know... We have to go back. A shriek pierces the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck that!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: They’re still following us..... come on. REBECCA pulls SAM after her, and we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The CAM-CORDER is lying on its side, filming SARAH lying unconscious. Her eyelids are flickering. We ZOOM in one t FINDER and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
