dialogues.text: We see the same image again, five candles. JESSICA. Darkn the background, indistinctly, we see PAUL and SARAH smili JESSICA’s shoulder. Nightmarishly, discordantly we hear t strains of ‘HAPPY BIRTHDAY’.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH wakes up and doesn’t know where she is. Her HELMET smashed and her TORCH nowhere to be found. All she can re HOLLY’S CAM-CORDER. The first thing she spots is an old MINING lamp, a name p roughly on its side - ‘TAYLOR’ he activates it and looks through the INFRA-RED view find horrifying sight. Human remains - a skull, and next to it arts of a skeleton. Beyond that, more human remains, mixe mong the animal carcasses and bones. LSpaowoan he cavern is like some kind of underground ABATTOIR. Fres nimal carcasses old and new litter the room, dumped here bove, ready to be stripped and devoured. Giant Elk, deer, cougar lie with their throats ripped out, blood everywher t’s a vision of Hell. Ho @9 DH AARRAH uses the camera to assess the cavern and find a wa hen she hears a noise from the gallery above, (where she own). She rapidly backs into its darkest shadows, directl eneath the gallery. here are more noises from above, then silence, and sudden OLLY’s CORPSE is dropped right in front of her! SARAH rec n shock, as HOLLY, blood-soaked and battered, lies there, taring back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SNAP LIGHT attached to her belt is still working, and f the cavern with an eerie GREEN GLOW!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO staggers against a wall and throws up. Behind her the sounds of CRAWLERS echo through the tunnel hurries on and we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: REBECCA and SAM are hurrying away from the sound of the CRAWLERS, when REBECCA spots a LEDGE up in the side of th tunnel.  126 127 68.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Up there! Hurry... They waste no time in crawling into the tight space, in t that the CRAWLERS may overtake them in the darkness. As t SAM drops the BLUE CHEMICAL SNAP LIGHTS she is holding an clatter to the floor of the tunnel. She tries to go back them, but REBECCA grabs her REBECCA (cont'd) Forget them...hurry! The two women crawl onto the high ledge, switch off their TORCHES and HELMET LAMPS and lie silently on the ledge, S behind, REBECCA in front, with only the BLUE glow of the LIGHTS to give them any sense of comfort.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH hears a new sound, from all around. A lower, less aggressive rasp, as several CRAWLERS emerge from the shad into this LAIR, and approach the fresh meat of HOLLY’s CO SARAH freezes, and waits... SARAH can only cower and watch through the CAM-CORDER as CRAWLERS gather around the fresh kill and begin ripping i apart. SARAH closes her eyes, gagging. But one of the CRAWLERS, ‘SCAR’, between SARAH and HOLLY’ corpse, smells something new, and turns its attention tow

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: SARAH, sensing something close, opens her eyes to see (th the CAM-CORDER) the CRAWLERS face, inches from her own, i closed, sniffing the air. SARAH holds her breath. The CRA opens its eyes wide to reveal two yellow eyeballs. Following its nose, the CRAWLER rises upwards, to the roc then turns its attention back to the main course, but SAR trapped....

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: REBECCA and SAM lie silently together as they hear the so something approaching. It’s a CRAWLER, moving cautiously, hunting by sound, searching for them.  128 69. SAM gasps, and REBECCA quickly puts her hand over her mou The CRAWLER is very close, climbing along the wall. A gaunt, clammy hand touches the rock beside SAM’s face. CRAWLER is moving along the wall, right over them in the darkness, skimming past their bodies. It seems totally un of the light source as its yellow eyes seem to glow in th GLOW. They try to remain absolutely still as the CRAWLER briefly, right next to REBECCA’s face. It’s so close she taste its rancid breath in her mouth. It listens, senses nothing, and moves on. REBECCA takes her hands from SAM’s mouth....

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It couldn’t see us..... The seconds tick by, and in time the coast seems clear. Then the terrible bleeping of a digital alarm! Along the the CRAWLER spins about SAM (cont’d) (whimpers) My fucking watch... SAM struggles and throws the watch as far back along the as she can. Almost instantly the CRAWLER rushes past in pursuit of th noise. REBECCA and SAM lie quiet and still, not daring to muscle. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A distant light appears in the pitch darkness, heading th along dank, dripping tunnels. JUNO, alone, moves cautiously through the maze of caverns trying to find traces of SARAH, REBECCA and SAM. Using a (silent) GREEN SNAP-LIGHT, she weaves this way and that listening out for CRAWLERS, PICK in hand, ready for anyth Reaching a junction between several interconnecting tunne notices an ARROW scrawled on the tunnel wall. It means something....  129 130 131 70. She looks and listens along each of the tunnels, and thro she can hear the faint whistling of a breeze. A breeze means one thing..... A WAY OUT.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH is still trapped, and in the semi-darkness, lit onl HOLLY’s SNAP LIGHT, all she can hear is the sound of her being torn apart! It’s driving her insane, but she cannot herself away. SUDDENLY, from elsewhere, the sound of a falling rock ech through the CAVERNS, then a voice....faint but audible...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah...... ? The CRAWLERS turn to the sound, and in one sudden movemen pack dart out of the LAIR on the hunt again! SARAH takes a deep breath of rancid air, almost gagging o foulness.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO has arrived at a junction between two tunnels and do know which one to take.... There’s only one thing for it.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: REBECCA?! Can anybody hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: REBECCA and SAM hear her....

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s Juno.......

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: The noise she’s making she’1ll bring everyone of those things down on her head.  132 133 71.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: As long as it’s not on mine.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We can’t stay here forever. Together, they shuffle out of their hiding place...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH carefully emerges from the shadows now that the coa clear. She edges toward the fractured remains of HOLLY...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.... Carefully she pulls the PICK HANDLE (used as a makeshift on Holly’s leg) free from the blood and gore, steaming in cold darkness. It’s a grisly job. Once that’s free, SARAH lifts HOLLY’s upper body so she can remove her outer laye clothing. It’s tricky, icky, awkward work, but SARAH finally manage and allows HOLLY’s body to slump back to the ground. Now wraps the clothing around the end of the PICK handle, the the MINERS LAMP, unscrews the cap and douses her makeshif in oil. Finally she takes out a lighter and strikes it up, lighti TORCH and filling this killing house with a hot flickerin orange glow. Unable to climb out the way she fell in, she moves deeper the LAIR, carefully treading between the detritus of deat

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO finds another ARROW and again follows it backwards, another junction and yet another ARROW.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Rebecca..... Sarah?!!!  134 72. She’s forgetting herself, carried away by the possibility hope. But that hope is shattered by the sudden SHRIEK of CRAWLER in reply to her calls...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: REBECCA and SAM hear this too. They freeze and throw them against the wall, carefully edging toward the corner, fro the SHRIEK came from. This CRAWLER is getting closer. Carefully, slowly, REBECCA peers around the corner, breat hard and fast, the sweat running from her brow.... but th tunnel is empty. SAM is looking the other way, covering their rear, as REB turns back....

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s clear.... They turn the corner, but as they do, the CRAWLER appears from below but from above! It is hanging upside down from roof and it lashes out at REBECCA, slashing her across th shoulder. She gets clear in time to swipe back at it with PICK, but misses! In the BLUE of her SNAP LIGHT, the CRAW opens its yellow eyes and SHRIEKS loudly at them. REBECCA (cont ‘d)

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: REBECCA backs away, SAM behind her, but the CRAWLER keeps with them, dogging them as they retreat. REBECCA swipes t at it whenever it gets too close. But they quickly find themselves cornered, backed up agai wall with nowhere left to run. If they try to move left o right, the CRAWLER counters them. REBECCA (cont’d) Sam....when I say...run!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I won’t go without you!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Just do it! Now! In desperation REBECCA lunges at the CRAWLER, swiping wit pick with her LEFT hand. The CRAWLER backs off, and SAM r it!  135 136 137 138 73. Almost immediately SAM runs into something (OFF SCREEN) a comes to a startled halt! REBECCA swings the PICK at the CRAWLERS head but the CRAW grabs it and pushes her back against the WALL, holding he the throat and opening its WIDE JAWS ready to take a bite SUDDENLY another PICK comes whooshing out of the darkness spinning through the air and embedding itself in the CRAW back! The CRAWLER buckles backward, trying to pull the PICK out between its shoulders! REBECCA looks up just as JUNO (followed by SAM) appears f shadows beyond, then she drives her own PICK into the CRA chest, and all three women attack the beast with whatever to hand! The CRAWLER lets out a piercing shriek, like a c help, as it goes down beneath the blows.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH hears the cry. It sends a shiver down her spine, as stops, listening, waiting....

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO finishes it off by caving its skull in with a rock. and desperate the three exhausted women look at each othe new found understanding between them.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH, feeling more confident, moves on, carrying her bur torch. She is still making her way through the low hangin vaults of the LAIR, nervously looking around, expecting t CRAWLERS to return at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO and REBECCA share a quick tight embrace.  74.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We heard you calling for Sarah. You seen Beth?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: bane She fell. I lost her... I don’t think she made it. The women are silent. No one can find anything to say as horror of the situation settles over them. Then SAM looks at the mutilated CRAWLER, the first one they have seen up JUNO (cont’d) What is it, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but.. it looks almost human.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Not anymore it doesn’t. Come on. We have to find the others.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Wait. Take a good look at it Sam. Tell us what we’re dealing with here. It might help us fight them.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well, it’s almost totally blind, and judging from what we’ve seen I’d say it uses sound and smell to see with and hunt with, like a bat. It’s perfectly designed to live down here in the dark. And it got some sort of blood infection, that's what makes it yellow. Jaundice?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: How did it get here?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: People lived in these caves, the ones who did the paintings.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What? These things ATE the cavemen?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No. They evolved. I think they ARE the cavemen.  139 75. They look at each other, the horror of this possibility d on them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Whatever they are, they come and go to the surface to hunt, right? They bring their food down here to eat. If we can stay quiet enough, and evade these fuckers....I think I’ve found the way out.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You THINK?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: The climbing gear we found. Whoever brought that in here marked their route so they could find their way back out... I’ve found the markings.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So what are we waiting for JUNO looks back at her....

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah....We have to find Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SARAH scans the entire LAIR, sweeping the torch back and looking for Beth. As SARAH heads down toward the far end of the LAIR she st and falls. We TRACK across the sea of bodies and bones li the floor of this cavern, towards Sarah. As she starts to pick herself up SARAH realizes her hand touching something. Something strange. She turns... She is touching a HUMAN LEG. She clears away some debris reveal the rest of the body. It’s lying face down, but we tell it is the body a woman. Some of the flesh has been s from the lower legs by razor sharp teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (whimpering) Oh god oh god...  76. Sarah already knows who it is, but she reaches out anyway turn BETH’s body over, revealing the gaping neck wound in by JUNO.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Beth... SARAH raises BETH’s upper body from the ground and cradle in her arms. As she lowers BETH’s body back to the ground Beth’s eyes OPEN. She’s not dead yet. Not quite. Sarah jolts in shock. BETH’s words are hissed out in a hi laboured rasp.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah. Run.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m going to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (calm) No. I can’t move. I can’t - feel. Anything. (Beat ) I couldn’t even feel my legs when the... things... started...[eating them]

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I heard Juno calling me. She’s alive. I’m going to find her and we are going to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Stay away from her. She did this to me. She left me to die.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No Beth. No she didn’t...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (hissing) LISTEN TO ME SARAH! YOU CAN’T TRUST HER! SHE’S DANGEROUS!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She’s our friend. Juno’s our friend.  140 141 142 143 77.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: SHE’S A FUCKING BITCH AND SHE ALWAYS

dialogues.speaker: HAS BEEN
dialogues.text: (Beat ) She was fucking him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Paul. She was fucking him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT _- WHITE WATER RAFT
dialogues.text: On the edge of the rapids, JUNO clocks PAUL and JESSICA b

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Let’s make ‘em proud. There is a hint of cruel mockery in JUNO’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is almost trance like.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: SARAH’s POV: PAUL pulls the soaking JUNO towards him. For moment their eyes lock with hungry lust, oblivious to the surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH coughs up blood. SARAH snaps out of her trance, look blank, empty.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sarah...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Take this. BETH removes the WHISTLE from around her neck and hands i Sarah. Their hands touch as SARAH takes it from her. TEAR streaming down her face, SARAH places the whistle around neck and tucks it into her top, just like BETH wore it. In the distance we hear the shriek of a Crawler.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Don’t leave me like this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? BETH looks at her intently.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Don’t leave me like this. CLOSE on SARAH as she realizes what BETH is asking her to

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Close your eyes. SARAH reaches down and finds a JAGGED ROCK. As she raises

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT: Sarah’s tiny figure as she brings the ROCK dow smooth, merciful, arc.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ECU OF SARAH’S FACE. EYES CLOSED. EXPRESSIONLESS. She hears a noise from elsewhere in the cavern and grabs TORCH, swinging it around to see a lone CRAWLER, stealthi creeping up on her, about 20 feet away.  79. With a valedictory glance at BETH’s dead body, SARAH bolt it, running as fast as she can toward the first available She’s a machine. She spots a tunnel and heads for it, but before she can r it, the floor of bones gives way beneath her. The lower end of the LAIR is a drainage pool, stacked hig animal carcasses, thick with clotted blood and covered in much dust and debris it looks like a solid floor, but it’ 4 or 5 feet deep. SARAH plunges headfirst into this blood-pool, her torch f from her hand and landing on the far side. When SARAH surfaces again, all trace of her beauty and hu have vanished. She is covered in blood. After this Hellis baptism SARAH is now as frightening as anything else in t cave. She looks around, trying to spot the CRAWLER, but there i sign of it. She turns and heads for the tunnel, but almos immediately the CRAWLER bursts up out of the blood-pool i of her, bloody as Hell. It grabs her and the two of them disappear under the surf together. For a moment the surface of the pool goes calm....then th emerge, engaged in a_ ferocious battle, lashing out at ea other in savage fury. They have each other by the throat squeezing tightly. The CRAWLER is stronger and tries to f SARAH’s head under again. As she goes she reaches around her free hand, trying to find something, anything, she ca as a weapon. Just as her face disappears beneath the surface and blood into her gasping, open mouth, she grabs hold of a RIB BON thrusts its sharp broken tip into the CRAWLER’S eye. The CRAWLER wails and SARAH spits out blood, pushing the BONE deeper and deeper into the CRAWLER’S eye socket, for the CRAWLER underwater and keeping it there until it stop struggling. Exhausted, SARAH fights her way to the edge of the pool, with great effort hauls herself out onto the rim, where s collapses, face down, gasping in air. Then, just beyond her, we see something move. Another CRA has entered the LAIR. SARAH, looking toward us, becomes a its presence, and freezes still. She’s still covered in b much like everything else in the lair.  145 146 80. She stays absolutely still as the CRAWLER, sniffing the a moves along the edge of the pool toward her. Then the CRAWLERS hand rests on SARAH’s head, as it sniff air, listening for signs of life. After a moment it moves on, and SARAH very slowly, very carefully reaches out toward a massive ELK THIGH BONE lyi nearby. The CRAWLER comes up close, sniffing the air before us, a behind it, we can see the crimson form of SARAH rising up slowly, menacingly like some savage goddess. SARAH takes a deep breath and lets it out, the CRAWLER sn the air, sensing the new smell, and turns back toward SAR as she brings the THIGH BONE crashing down on its skull, and again, her eyes blinded by blood and rage! Finally she stops and slumps down. Drained. Then she hears it, the distant SHRIEK of many CRAWLERS, c from all around her. She looks up, with eyes now cold and merciless.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO, REBECCA and SAM hear the SHRIEK too, but for them i much closer, and coming their way.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Go on, follow the markings, hurry....! REBECCA and SAM hurry off, finding the ARROWS and followi backwards. JUNO waits behind, wanting to be certain that CRAWLERS are coming after them. She shines her torch alon tunnel into the darkness, moving slowly forward as the SH get louder, growing in numbers. JUNO (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then she sees them, all of them, CRAWLING out of the dark toward her en masse. Moving fast, on all fours, along the ground, the walls and the roof of the tunnel, twenty or m them, heading this way! At the front of the pack is SCAR! JUNO turns -  81. JUNO (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SAM and REBECCA hit a junction and quickly find the ARROW on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Juno, this way! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She’s DEAD, Juno! We can’t wait for her! JUNO stares hard at REBECCA, knowing she’s probably right REBECCA (cont ‘d) Come ON! SAM runs off ahead, while REBECCA waits to see if JUNO is following. REBECCA (cont’d) SAM?! Wait! Once she sees JUNO’s light coming, she takes off after SA

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Now WE too are running along the tunnels as fast as we ca weaving this way and that, first ahead of them, then behi at the front, REBECCA in the middle and JUNO bringing up rear, stopping briefly to check behind her, then taking o again at speed. It’s a frantic chase, with the CRAWLERS b at their heels.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SAM finds another ARROW and follows its course backwards REBECCA is with her now and JUNO not far behind.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SAM runs into a pool of water but keeps on going. REBECCA follows but stumbles, falling headlong, until JUNO grabs pulls her to her feet.  148 149 82. She’s limping now. Then REBECCA notices that SAM has missed a turning and an telling them to go in a different direction. REBECCA (cont’d) SAM! It’s the wrong way!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Shit! Come ON! They follow SAM, JUNO supporting the injured REBECCA.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SAM crawls on hands and knees through a low tunnel and al runs over the edge of this vertical drop, but stops herse time. The tunnel has run out, and before her lies a deep similar to the one REBECCA crossed earlier, about twenty across, with no way around it. On stopping so suddenly SAM has sent several rocks tumbli the edge into oblivion. Now she hears them splash down in far below. Above her, the roof of the cavern arcs over the gorge, an there she sees her chance. Emulating her big sister, she crack spanning the roof that could take her to the far si she’s desperate enough to try it. She hammers in a piton, ties on a safety rope, climbs up puts her hand into the CRACK, clenches it and lets it tak weight! The pain is unbearable and she gasps as we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: REBECCA and JUNO hurry after SAM, reaching the low segmen tunnel....

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You go first! Stop her! I’1l be right behind you! JUNO crawls in first and REBECCA follows.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SAM is resolute and determined. Shaking with the strain, pulls herself up far enough to secure the spring loaded G and hook on her safety line. JUNO emerges from the low tunnel to see SAM is halfway ac the void.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sam! What are you doing?! You can’t do it! Come back! SAM?! SAM looks back at JUNO with a mix of steely resolve and t her eyes, the pain she is enduring is unbelievable but sh not give in. JUNO (cont'd) (calling back) Rebecca, hurry! A CRAWLER lets out a loud SHRIEK, and JUNO traces the sou It’s ahead of SAM. SAM looks up and sees it coming across roof, upside down, toward her REBECCA, crawls out of the tunnel and sees it too!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No ....SAM, GET OUT OF THERE! HURRY! SAM looks at the CRAWLER, looks at her own situation, and that she’s not going to make it back to the near side in Then she looks directly at REBECCA across the void. No wo needed. REBECCA looks back at her in floods of tears. SAM wedges in one more GRAPNEL, hooks her SAFETY line on and with her free hand, takes her CLASP KNIFE from its sh and puts it between her teeth, before moving hand over ha directly toward the CRAWLER! REBECCA (cont’d) What are you doing!? SAM, NO! But SAM has death in mind and she and the CRAWLER meet he SAM doesn’t stand a chance, hanging above the gorge with one free hand, but she does manage to take a few slashes CRAWLER until it suddenly lashes out at her and, with its rips open her throat! SAM hangs their momentarily in shock as blood gushes out, she looks up at the CRAWLER, hissing back at her, upside  84. She suddenly swings her legs up and wraps them around the CRAWLER’S back before letting go with her hand. Now she wraps her arms around its neck and, blinded by he blood, drives her KNIFE into the CRAWLER’S heart. REBECCA can only watch in horror and sorrow as her sister to the death. REBECCA (cont‘d) NNNNNOOOOOOOOOO! HH! HHH Eri itt The CRAWLER shrieks loudly and cannot hold on any longer. weight of SAM pulls it from the roof and together they dr the abyss. The safety rope reaches its limit and SAM’s body is whip- to a halt, while the CRAWLER keeps falling, shrieking as falls, until it hits the WATER below with a loud splash. SAM is left hanging at the end of the ROPE, swinging back forth like a pendulum. REBECCA is a quivering wreck as JUNO embraces her, forcin to look away, a tear in her own eye as she looks at SAM, from the end of the rope. REBECCA slumps against the wall as JUNO considers the mor pressing matter of their own survival. She stands on the looking down, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Rebecca. We can’t stay here...

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Then go. I don’t care anymore.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: No, Rebecca, we can still get out! We HAVE to!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What does it matter? We’re fucked. We were fucked the moment we set foot in this place.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I am NOT going to die in this fucking hellhole!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Don’t you understand?! It’s the cave. IT WANTS US TO DIE! IT WON’T LET US

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REBECCA is suddenly yanked off her feet! She lands face d the wind knocked out of her

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: The CRAWLERS are here! They are pulling REBECCA back into LOW TUNNEL. The shock brings REBECCA back to her senses, and she claw the rock and dirt! JUNO grabs hold of her BANDAGED HAND a REBECCA screams out in pain as she kicks at her attackers they grab her feet and pull her deeper into the tunnel!

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: But JUNO can barely hold on to the blood-soaked BANDAGE a REBECCA is yanked forcefully backward.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Rebecca, hold on!! JUNO cries out in rage as REBECCA is yanked free and drag kicking and screaming into the tunnel, resisting every st the way, scraping her fingernails across the rocks, stari into JUNO’s eyes until she vanishes from sight.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: JUNO backs away from the tunnel toward the edge of the go She knows they’1l be coming for her next. She knows she h little choice. She doesn’t have time to scale the cavern roof. She turns looks down. Preparing to jump.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: POV - Coming out of the tunnel toward JUNO’s back, closer closer until... JUNO swallows a breath and leaps into inf

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: JUNO drops away into the pitch darkness. Silence. The vas deadly silence of the cave. She disappears for what seems like an eternity until we

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Looking upward from below as a faint glow appears, growin closer until JUNO hits the water, illuminated by the SNAP she is holding.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: JUNO floats to the surface, intermittently lit up by the from SAM’s torch, swinging back and forth high above her The pool itself is entirely enclosed, with water dripping pouring down from the walls above. From one side a small waterfall gushes steadily from a fi in the wall, dropping about 15 feet into the pool. JUNO, dazed by the impact of the fall, flounders in the w Weak from exhaustion, she begins to sink, as she’s bathed warm fiery glow. A hand reaches down to her...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0S)
dialogues.text: Juno! Grab my hand! JUNO weakly reaches up and grabs her hand. SARAH hauls he and out of the water, onto the rocks. JUNO looks up at her saviour. SARAH’s hair is hanging down across her face, matted and dishevelled. Her clothes, what remains of them, are tatte torn, her bare arms and legs stained with blood and laced cuts and bruises. She looks every inch the primal savage.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Sarah..... SARAH says nothing as she pulls JUNO up beside her. JUNO instinctively embraces her, but as she does she becomes a the matted blood in SARAH’s hair. She backs away, looking own hands, now covered in the same blood... JUNO (cont'd) Oh my God....what happened?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I killed some of them...Rebecca? Sam?  87.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO

In time she looks around and sees bones, human bones, not few but hundreds, maybe thousands, piled up against the w like a giant waste tip. The bones are ancient, brittle an white. Among the bones lie items of Native American paraphernalia. But finally her attention is drawn to the source LIGHT th shines on her. High above, at the top of the BONE MOUNTAI daylight is shining in through a cleft in the rock SARAH gazes up at it, drawn to it, the way out. She begins to scramble up the mound of BONES, clawing her upward, on hands and knees, toward the light... At last, and with extreme effort, she reaches the top and up through the narrow CLEFT, toward the daylight beyond.
